column8: The DAP-led Penang government is only making cosmetic changes to the strong fundamentals laid down by the previous Barisan Nasional government, said Datuk Seri Johari Abdul Ghani (pic).The Second Finance Minister said the development in Penang today was the result of the hard work of Barisan, which had built infrastructure, brought in foreign direct investment, and developed the financial and services industry.“Even today, we are still building and expanding infrastructure projects in the state such as the Penang International Airport, federal roads, highways and other projects.“Penang may be an Opposition-held state but we believe in continuous development of the state as it benefits the country as a whole,” said Johari when opening the Bayan Baru Umno division delegates meeting here on Saturday.On another matter, Johari, who is an Umno supreme council member, said Barisan parties such as MCA, Gerakan, MIC and MyPPP look to Umno to lead the coalition.“Umno must remain strong to steer the coalition during the present challenging times and every member should focus on unity within the party,” he added.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...zmQDv7KExGGX.99
